summary: This is a brief email from a Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, attempting to schedule a call regarding the Epstein case. It indicates ongoing coordination within the prosecution team.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email, attempting to schedule a call regarding the Epstein case from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated September 17, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The communication originates from the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
The subject is 'Epstein', indicating the case was still active and under discussion.
The email shows coordination efforts within the prosecution team following Epstein's death.
The document is part of the publicly released Epstein case files.
